RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming races for $10,000 or less not considered in allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HURTS SO BAD showed sharp early speed to set the early pace from the inside and drew off to well clear through the stretch run while under steady handling. TIZWOW stalked the early going three deep, raced three to four wide around the far turn and got up for the place position late. TEA WITH LEMON was off slowly, raced near the back of the pack early on, made a steady advance towards the leaders through the far turn while racing near the inside and flattened out in the drive while racing two to three wide. SOVIET STANDARD dropped back early to race off the early pace, raced from the outside in the stretch run, improved position but had not for the top trio. I'M YOUR CAPTAIN stalked the pace along the inside and faded. CHAD'S FLASH chased the early going three deep from the outside of rivals and gave way in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Hurts So Bad
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside, drew off, well clear, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Tea With Lemon
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, steady advance, flattened out, 2-3 wide

ENTRY.NAME: Soviet Standard
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, outside bid, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Chad's Flash
ENTRY.OWNER: Golobic Martin Rodriguez Eduardo and Rodriguez Ricardo

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. FOR ILLINOIS REGISTERED, CONCEIVED AND/OR FOALED. Maidens, Three Years Old and Upward. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAN ON ATTACK chased the top pair racing from the inside, moved up to split rivals nearing the three sixteenths pole and finished strongly to edge clear under strong pressure racing four to five wide. J J'S SOLUTION raced near the back of the pack early, moved up four to three wide in the stretch run and rallied for the place position late. SILVER CHILLER showed good early speed to set the early pace while racing just off the inside and weakened the final eighth of a mile. A P BLAZING GREEN settled off the early going racing near the inside down the backstretch, continued to race near the inside the stretch run and lacked a rally. MARE'S GUNNER tracked the early leader from the outside and was empty in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Man On Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside, split 3/16, drew clear, driving, 4-5 wide

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 80. Claiming Purse 10500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES IN 2022 - 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 28, 2022. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming race s for $4,000 or less not considered in eligibility and allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: IDEA MAN settled off the early going, raced near the rail in the stretch run and finished well to prove best under strong handling. RISKY BOY tracked the early leader from the outside of foe and kept on willingly to the wire. ONE WAY HOME stalked the early pace, dropped back around the far turn, raced from the outside in the stretch and moved up late. GREELEYS ICE was slow early, raced two wide around the far turn, shifted out nearing the sixteenth pole and had no late rally. CHOPPER was quick to begin to set the early pace, drifted through the upper stretch and was empty in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Greeleys Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, 2p turn, shifted out 1/16, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: One Way Home
ENTRY.OWNER: Martinez Ralph and Martin Paul E
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, outside bid, moved up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 4 5F Turf CR: 87. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000 (Claiming races for $8,500 or less not considered in estimating allowances). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at Five Furlongs on the main track. (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GRAND HIDEAWAY stalked the pace along the inside, angled four wide through the upper stretch and finished well to edge clear under steady handlig. DRAGON DREW dueled for the early lead near the rail, shook clear near the quarter pole, collared inside the eighth pole and kept on willingly to the wire. WINGING WAYS dueled from the outside of foe and weakened a bit through the stretch drive. REMEMBER THE MAINE chased the early going, was near the inside around the far turn and raced evenly with no closing run racing four to five wide. MIDNIGHT BLUE NOTE was slow early, angled widest in the lane and never threatened. READTHETRANSCRIPT raced mid pack early, was near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and lacked a bid. WILDWOOD SECRET chased the pace from the outside, raced five to six wide into the upper stretch and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Midnight Blue Note
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, angled widest lane, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 28 OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES IN 2022 - 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners of a race since Ap ril 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Claiming races for $4,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARCH FLYER tracked the early leader from the outside racing two deep, challenged for the lead nearing the eighth pole and finished well to get up under strong encouragement racing four to three wide. MI CRESCENDO was off the early going, raced from the far outside in the stretch run and closed in well late. COUGER raced along the inside around the far turn, was four wide between rivals in the stretch run and finished willingly to the wire. AUNT STELLA was off slowly, chased the pace from the inside and raced evenly late. FOGGY KITTEN showed good early foot from the inside and weakened the final eighth of a mile. RANK AND FILE was void of early speed, raced three to four wide and had no late rally. TAP N TWINE chased from the outside, raced five wide through the upper stretch and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Rank and File
ENTRY.COMMENT: void of speed, 3-4 wide, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Mi Crescendo
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, outside bid, closing in

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 103. Handicap Purse 75000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. (Illinois Registered Conceived and/or foaled.) (Preference will be given to original nominees to The Robert S Molaro Stakes).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAST JACK showed good early speed to set the early pace along the inside, dug in late and prevailed under all out pressure. W W SCOUT'S HONOR was rated along to race in hand early, moved up three to four wide around far turn and finished gamely to the wire to just miss. WILDWOOD SICILIAN chased the early leader down the backstretch, raced two to three wide in the drive and kept on willingly to the wire. HUEY ATTACK was bumped at the break, raced mid pack early, was four to five wide in the drive and raced evenly late. W W HOTSHOT broke to the outside, bumped with rival, raced mid pack early and had no late rally racing three deep. HELA was off a step slow, raced at the back of the pack in the early stages, was near the inside around the far turn through the stretch and never threatened. WALKER'S WIN stumbled at the break, lost a considerable amount of ground, raced four to five wide around the far turn and had no late response while racing from the outside.

ENTRY.NAME: Walker's Win
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break, 4-5 wide turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Hela
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, inside, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: W W Hotshot
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out, bumped start, mid pack, no rally, 3-wide

ENTRY.NAME: Fast Jack
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, set pace, dug in, prevailed,

ENTRY.NAME: W W Scout's Honor
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 7 1M Turf CR: 87. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR STATE BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $50,000. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners of a race at a mile or over since April 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claimin g Price $50,000 (Claiming races for $40,000 or less not considered in estimating allowances) (Preference by condition eligibility). In the event that this race is taken off the turf it will be contested at One Mile and Seventy Yards on the main track. (Ra il at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SIVAKO was unhurried early on, moved up through the far turn, raced from the outside in the stretch run, surged late and just got up under all out pressure. BAL A KAZOO was bumped at the start, stalked the pace racing four deep, raced five to six wide into the upper stretch and finished gamely to the wire. BEN DREAMING tracked early pace from the inside of rivals, led near the eighth pole and kept on willingly to the wire while continuing an inside run. MCMONEY was bumped at the start, rated under a firm hold early, raced two to three wide between in the drive and kept on to the wire. SLAVA UKRAINI stalked the early pace, raced four to five wide through the upper stretch and was outkicked late. RUSSIAN HAMMER settled off the early pace, raced along the inside into the upper stretch, angled and had no late rally. G T FIVE HUNDRED dropped back early on, raced along the inside around the far turn, angled out inside the eighth pole and lacked a closing bid. STAR NATION raced off the early going, swung wide into the upper lane and never threatened. ELI'S PROMISE showed good early speed to set the early pace and faltered in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Star Nation
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, swung wide upper stretch, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Sivako
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, outside bid, surged, just up, all out

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Pollock Farms & Town & Country HorseFarms, LLC

ENTRY.NAME: McMoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, rated, kept on, 2-3 wide between

ENTRY.NAME: Bal a Kazoo
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, stalked 4p, 5-6 wide upper, gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Russian Hammer
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, inside upper stretch, angled, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: G T Five Hundred
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside far turn, angled 1/8, no bid

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HAWTHORNE RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 87. Maiden Special Weight Purse 30000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference by condition eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHARP AZ NAILS dueled for the early lead from the outside of foe and proved best to get up under strong handling. TAHOE RUN dueled for the early leader while racing near the rail and kept on gamely to the wire. GONE AGAIN stalked the early duel and kept on in the drive while racing three to four wide. LARRY THE POET broke sharply to the inside, rushed a bit early from the inside, raced from the inside around the far turn and raced evenly late with no closing run. SHARP STICK raced off the early pace, was four to five wide in the lane and showed late interest. MAMAS FIRE was off a step slow, raced near the back of the pack early on, raced from the outside in the lane and had no late rally. ARMAVIR was unhurried early on, raced five wide into the upper stretch and never was a factor. RUSSIAN STANDARD was off slowly, saved ground and never threatened.

ENTRY.NAME: Larry the Poet
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in sharply, inside turn, evenly

ENTRY.NAME: Russian Standard
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slowly, saved ground, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Gone Again
ENTRY.OWNER: Ritter Charles W and Becker Scott

ENTRY.NAME: Armavir
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, 5wd upper stretch, no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Mamas Fire
ENTRY.OWNER: Smokey Creek Farm and DeLong, Georgianna
ENTRY.COMMENT: off step slow, outside lane, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Tahoe Run
ENTRY.OWNER: Robertson Hugh H Mentz John and Larson Jeff
